pros: Lots of support from colleagues and managers
cons: Low pay for the job done

review_title: Staff turnover is high for a reason
pros: Opportunities to up skill are good as well as CPD Facilities are good and technology is fantastic Some senior leaders are good and can see the bigger picture. The structure of welfare team and pastoral side is strong
cons: If you work at the main site, there is no free parking. All senior leaders have car parking. Others have to buy a permit or park up the hill which makes locals very angry. Salaries are some of the worst in the UK for FE colleges. There are no cover teachers which means teachers have to take on more and more without getting time back or being reimbursed for their time. Work life balance is poor. Some senior leaders are unkind and unrealistic. Prizes and awards are selected which polarise people and make them feel unwanted. There is a lot of corruption.

pros: Passionate staff who care about learners Great facilities and resources Opportunity to learn
cons: Uncertainty in industry due to politics

pros: Reasonable holiday allowance. Ok salary.
cons: Middle Management were not only ineffective, but were rude, ignorant and obnoxious - local management were ok. They made fleeting visits to the site, forcing their agenda aggressively without listening to the local team's thoughts.

review_title: Corruption and profit making from vulnerable humans - bums on seats = £
job_title: Lecturer in Weston, South West England, England
pros: No ports that I can think of
cons: Corruption - money grabbing without real care for learners. Seems to be a whole lot of nepotism as the incompetence of my line manager was unimaginable. There was no accountability for many staff members being forced to leave due to a toxic unbearable work environment. Upper management ignored all red flags even when the mental health of many staff members was flagged. Staff not recognised for their skills and given no autonomy. Bullying rife. Money put before learning experience and openly accepted as spoken about as normal.

pros: The pay was good for an entry level position
cons: Toxic work culture Poor working flexibility Bad work-life balance Unhappy workforce

pros: Great internal promotion opportunities, management really do care about you, learner led, very strategic and forward thinking
cons: Can be long hours and pay isn't always that great

pros: Supportive environment, great CPD opportunities. Would recommend to anyone.
cons: Busy, but it's never boring!

review_title: Just in it for the money
pros: None that I can think of.
cons: Senior management rife with corruption. Cutting corners on learning to push as many learners through to grab government cash Definitely something dodgy going on with OFSTED... The college is far from outstanding, but always manages to achieve this.

pros: Great holiday allowance. Supportive and friendly team
cons: A bit chaotic but that's largely due to prison movement. Pay pretty poor

pros: fun and nice people work here
cons: the lifts take about 10 minutes

pros:
Some good ground level team members
long term employment

No progression in the workplace, all managers have been in post for 10+ years.

Poor pay for the level of work and commitment they ask of you, unless you are a manager. 
Massive pay gap between leads/managers and ground level staff

pros: Able to Manage your own time

review_title: No longer on The Sunday Times top employer list (and for good reason)
pros:
* A proven equal opportunities employer
* Several generous employee perks
* Employees given more autonomy than usual
* Plenty of opportunities for development and advancement
* An excellent mentoring program for new employees (although possibly designed to discourage union membership)
* Excellent union reps available if needed
cons:
* Too many inexperienced line managers
* A very cliquey and unprofessional working environment
* A laissez-faire attitude to health and safety
* Employees are not paid a competitive salary
* Long waiting periods for essential resources
* Employees often put under added pressure to do irrelevant (and sometimes duplicate) training just so the college can draw down funding (and face large financial penalties if not completed)
* Run with an aggressive business model that puts both learner and employee secondary to the financial interests of the college

job_title: Apprenticeship Tutor Assessor in Weston, Hertfordshire, East of England, England
pros: Supportive working environment and great facilities.
cons: Nothing in particular to note

pros: Clear passion for the student and desire for them to achieve, an excellent place to grow professionally, and have your twist on how YOU want to educate your students.
cons: Sometimes lacking in organzation and communication. Sometimes underpaid relating to certain subject areas .

pros: Excellent principal, insecure senior leadership team who are detached from the realities of education. Fortunately this is overcome by excellent ground floor staff who keep things together to benefit the students
cons: Very high expectations from senior leaders. Excessive hours, once you have mastered new systemd to tick a box for Ofsted or a new teaching practice within 12 months something new is brought in to supersede it. Student admin input is normally duplicated as a result poor IT systems that don't talk to each other and management response is normally a case of just get it done.

pros: Wonderful colleagues and great facilities. Lots of training.
cons: Sometimes management do not communicate well with staff.

review_title: Supportive and developmental employer who care about their staff and students
pros: Forward thinking and supportive, continuously training and developing staff to ensure we are offering the best support and teaching experience to our students
cons: Busy! We never sit still, continuously evolving!

pros:
Pros:
Weston College supported me in my apprenticeship exactly as needed.
I was supported with my mental health perfectly.
I had lots of help and support, since this was my first job.
Diverse range of tasks to complete.
cons:
Tall management structure.
The odd communication issue between teams here and there.

pros: I could not find any positive
cons: Workload, no communication, no respect

job_title: IT Support Assistant in Weston-super-Mare, England
pros:
Reliable
Easy access
Problem solving
Good future options
cons: Travel is hard with lock down

pros: Staff, learners, working conditions, fun
cons: Distance I have to travel to work

pros: Supportive boss in my area of work
cons: More support from senior leadership

pros: salary was average and thats where the pros end
cons: they care more for the business rather than the staff

pros: The community of lecturers is good
cons:
Not a collegiate atmosphere between staff and management. Management tend towards a punitive approach
Very top-down organisation
Authoritarian approach
Management not willing to listen to criticism of any kind (even constructive), and will state openly that the criticism may not be voiced
Culture tends towards bullying and singling out, one or a number of members of staff will be 'targeted' in this way
Secretive and underhand techniques employed - I have witnessed the management conducting 'investigations' into lecturers by whispering leading questions to students in corridors, instead of open, honest and forthright discussion
Organisation not interested in doing anything to ameliorate the poor working conditions for their staff, workload increases year on year
Workload is impossible to keep on top of within working days
Pay is low for level of responsibility and  considering unpaid overtime expected
Extremely inflexible, however, they do expect flexibility their way
Unusual TOIL system in which TOIL is not always given for out of hours work
Unusual Holiday system in which not enough holiday is provided to cover the academic holidays
Very low entry requirements for students
Very high-pressure environment, not particularly conducive to learning and teaching
One of the teaching buildings is literally a panopticon - hello Michel Foucault!

Finally, I am not respected as a professional person with well over a decade of experience.

review_title: Ruthless yet incompetent management resulting in culture of fear and intimidation
pros: Salary is reasonable but not excellent. Students are usually pretty good.
cons:
Was my dream job until the promises failed to materialise and if a member of staff 'dares' to voice an opinion or seek redress they are systematically singled out then squeezed out. I witnessed it severalfold before it happened to me. Management promote a culture of fear and are driven by finance, a misunderstanding of Ofsted because the Quality Team are incompetent and egos. They say learners are at the heart of things but students = £££s and that is the chief motivator of Senior Management; made clear at the ridiculous Principle's Address twice yearly where staff are bribed to go with hampers and booze and bullied by statistics and targets. For the state of my mental health I had to go, yet I have seen the same story play out with several colleagues since. This may not be exclusive to WC and more symptomatic of FE and education in the UK generally but OFSTED needs to be proactive and ensure that trained and experienced teachers are valued and supported if the staff are to be retained for learners of the future and for new teachers to be encouraged to enter the profession because at the moment I have very little positivity for the job I once loved.
The holidays are limited (especially in the prison sector) & much controlling conditions placed about the when and how much time can be taken in spite of not working to an academic timetable.

review_title: One rule for one, one rule for another
pros:
Lots of nice staff who work hard and care about the students
Good annual leave allowance 
Good staff development for academic staff
Team culture
cons:
- Inconsistent approach with staff - mid-level staff  expected to work long hours with extreme demands, whilst some high levels of management come and go as they please and get the praise for doing very little.
- Some staff get singled out and constantly scrutinized by management whilst others get free reign to do as they please 
- Seen MANY times individuals getting forced out because they don't agree with senior managements way of doing things
- Very authoritarian, top down management approach
- Poor staff development for non-academics
- Only care about money and good statistics.
- An awful lot of money is spent on buying ridiculous staff gifts at end of term meetings, the worst ones are the end of line stuff bought from Argos, such as alarm clocks and crockery! Also as the college now employ so many staff these meetings go on forever whilst you sit there clapping away as yet another person you've never heard of runs up the front to shake the Principal's hand and get their bunch of flowers. I've literally seen people fall asleep in these end of term meetings. 'Special' (often the same) individuals are also often invited to private outings where everything is paid for. This further advances the culture of 'us and them' between management and lower level staff. 
- The quiet ones who work hard never get recognised.
- Senior management are very quick to shut you down if you don't agree with them. 
- Restructures take place every Summer - they always find a way to get rid of the staff they don't want any more.

pros: Big organisation with lots of opportunities
cons:
Profit before people. 
Uses (their own) agency to hide behind and treat staff very badly while avoiding taxes
No notice contracts 
No benefits 
Poor pay grades 
Financially driven and ruthless

review_title: The best in the West!! (or anywhere else!)
pros: Well supported by senior management. Excellent progression opportunities. Inspirational team ethos. All staff are passionate in everything they do.
cons: Workload can be high. General expectation that you will work above and beyond your contacted hours, if requested.

pros: Good pay, reasonable amount of holidays although not as many as college staff (I worked in a prison)
cons: Unsupportive; ruthless; over 10 colleagues went off sick with work-stress - including myself, and of those 10 only one remains. No understanding of environments outside their own main college. Worst company I've ever worked for.

review_title: college thats capable of so much but never delivers
pros: Students are incredibly well supported.
cons: Terrible management. Some of the woest I've ever seen. Little value actually placed on teachers and their knowledge and expertise.

pros: Lovely staff and mostly enthusiastic students
cons: Scary management more concerned with statistics than anything else. However this seems symptomatic of FE in general

pros:
